summary: Sir James Whyte Black, OM, FRS, FRSE, FRCP  was a Scottish doctor and pharmacologist.
full_text: Sir James Whyte Black OM FRS FRSE FRCP  was a Scottish pharmacologist. Black established the physiology department at the University of Glasgow, where he became interested in the effects of adrenaline on the human heart. He went to work for ICI Pharmaceuticals in 1958 and, while there, developed propranolol, a beta blocker used for the treatment of heart disease. Black was also responsible for the development of cimetidine, a H2 receptor antagonist, a drug used in a similar manner to treat stomach ulcers. He was awarded the Nobel Prize for Medicine in 1988 for work leading to the development of propranolol and cimetidine.
title: James W. Black
